Overview
Observability provides a measure of how well the internal state of a system can be inferred from its external output. Applied observability extends this principle and applies granular visibility across multiple technology domains such as applications, infrastructure, data, network, and security as well as business processes to provide valuable business insight. This ability to harness observability data enables increased innovation, improved resilience and enhanced customer adoption, engagement, and experience.
Historically, organizations found it difficult to either plan or learn from past failures due to insufficient data. However, we have an exact opposite problem today – it is not the lack but an overabundance of data that make it difficult to extract the right signals from noisy data. Applied observability is about aggregating, correlating, and analyzing observability data across multiple technology tiers and domains and making that data available for both business and technical roles to inform manual and autonomous decisions.
Applied observability can be defined as the ability to track the state and performance of software applications over time. It is a comprehensive approach for collecting data on software systems that can then be used to gain insights into system health, observability problems, and potential improvements.
This data can include logs, metrics, and events from all components of a software system, including the application and its underlying infrastructure. This data can then be used to generate real-time observability charts, reports, and insights that can help organizations quickly identify and resolve application and infrastructure observability issues. 
Applied observability offers a holistic and coordinated approach to utilizing observable data across multiple business areas. It shortens the lead time between stakeholder activities and organizational responses by providing a way for businesses to proactively plan decisions.
Observability data is only as useful as its ability to convert knowledge of the health and performance of individual systems to overall business health and performance. Connecting individual parts using telemetry across all layers of the business and IT systems topology is key to realizing the full benefits of observability. The core observability domains that underpin this trend include:
•	Data observability
•	Infrastructure observability including networks, endpoints, compute, storage, communication devices etc.
•	Application observability including services, APIs, databases, open-source, and 3rd party dependencies
•	Security observability
•	Business decision making related to product decisions
Applied observability extends the use of observability to address business intelligence issues. For example, tracking customer adoption and sustained use of a newly released feature requires continuous observability into user experience and usage patterns. The ability to obtain answers to exploratory questions using observability data helps to create new knowledge and bridge knowledge gaps for both engineering and business stakeholders in the organization.
According to Gartner’s research, by 2026, organizations that have successfully applied observability will be able to make decisions faster and gain a competitive edge over their competition. This is expected to account for 70% of all businesses.
With the integration of applied observability practices into a company’s data lifecycle management (DLM) approaches, organizations and software engineers can use their insights to create an all-encompassing view of operations. 
Nonetheless, this requires utilizing sophisticated tactics for analyzing business operations information to accurately decipher available facts. This equips decision-makers with the knowledge they need immediately to make wise decisions more quickly and effectively.
To reap the full benefits, businesses must ensure that their data is up-to-date and accurate. By utilizing AI-driven automation and machine learning, applied observability can yield greater accuracy and reliability in data capture while ensuring that the generated results apply to the specific needs of each enterprise.

Importance of Applied Observability
Applied observability is dedicated to the notion that a business’s success relies on forecasting what lies ahead, and crafting plans based on factual data. This aspiration serves as applied observability’s main compass for progress and growth. Through the diligent application of applied observability, businesses can reduce their response times to customer inquiries and bolster the efficacy of their daily operations.
To realize the advantages of observability, it is essential to be proactive instead of reactive. For example, IT professionals who leverage stakeholders’ actual behaviors and activities rather than merely relying on guesses or assumptions will have a significant edge over their competition. Analyzing observable data makes it possible to look for improvements in customer service, operational efficiency, and speed. 
Applied observability also enables organizations to uncover hidden patterns in their data that can help them identify operational issues, recognize trends, improve process optimization, increase customer satisfaction, make informed decisions regarding product launches, and realize cost savings.
Software engineering teams can reap tremendous benefits by employing observability as well. Testing various hypotheses and making data-driven decisions can minimize the risk of system failure and reduce development time. Observability solutions provide a comprehensive view of what’s going on within a system. This helps engineers quickly detect and diagnose issues and identify areas of improvement for system reliability.

Application of Applied Observability in an Organization
Applied observability provides businesses with real-time, actionable data to gain an understanding of their systems and operations. Companies can then use this data for several purposes, such as improving system performance, gaining insights into customer behaviour, and optimizing processes to increase efficiency. This can be achieved by monitoring the system’s performance and integrating applied observability into the existing analytics infrastructure, giving businesses a holistic view of their operations.
•	Monitoring software performance metrics such as response time, error rates, and throughput.
•	Tracking user behaviour and engagement on a website or mobile app.
•	Monitoring the health of production systems and infrastructure, including servers, databases, and network components.
•	Observing the behaviour of distributed systems, such as microservices architectures, to identify bottlenecks and optimize performance.
•	Analysing customer feedback and sentiment data to improve product features and user experience.
•	Monitoring supply chain processes and logistics to optimize operations and reduce costs.
•	Tracking environmental factors such as temperature, humidity, and air quality in industrial settings to ensure safety and compliance.
•	Monitoring financial transactions to detect fraud and ensure compliance with regulations.
•	Analysing social media activity to understand consumer sentiment and inform marketing strategies.
•	Observing employee behaviour and productivity to optimize workflows and increase efficiency.

Use case of Applied Observability for Banks
•	By implementing observability tools and services, banks can gain real-time insights into the performance of their trading platforms, including transaction speeds, error rates, and other key metrics. This data can be used to identify areas for improvement and optimize the platform for better performance. 
•	Observability tools and services can help banks monitor payment processing systems in real-time, identifying potential issues before they impact customers or cause disruptions. This can help banks improve the reliability and security of their payment processing systems, reducing the risk of fraud and other security breaches.

Implementation Risks and Challenges
•	Cost: Implementing observability practices can be expensive, as it may require investing in new tools, technologies, and infrastructure. The cost of maintaining and operating these practices can also add up over time.
•	False positives and alerts: Observability tools may generate a lot of false positives and alerts, leading to alert fatigue and reduced effectiveness. Teams need to be able to filter out noise and focus on the most critical issues.
•	Cultural resistance: Adopting observability practices may require a cultural shift in organizations, as it involves breaking down silos and promoting collaboration and transparency. Some teams may be resistant to change or reluctant to share information.
•	Bias and interpretation: Observability tools rely on data analysis and machine learning algorithms, which may introduce bias or errors in interpretation. Teams need to be aware of these limitations and verify the accuracy of the insights provided by the tools.
•	Legal and ethical considerations: Observability practices may raise legal and ethical concerns, such as privacy violations, discrimination, or surveillance. Organizations need to ensure that they comply with relevant laws and regulations and respect ethical principles.

Risks associated with Banks
•	Data privacy and security: Banks deal with sensitive customer data, and observability tools may collect a lot of information about their systems and operations. Ensuring that this data is protected from unauthorized access, breaches, or misuse is crucial.
•	Compliance and regulation: Banks are subject to various regulatory requirements and standards, such as PCI DSS, SOX, or GDPR. Implementing observability practices must comply with these regulations and avoid any violations or penalties.
•	Complexity and scale: Modern banking systems are complex and distributed, with multiple layers of technology, applications, and services. Observability tools must be able to handle this complexity and scale, providing actionable insights without overwhelming the teams. 
•	Integration and interoperability: Observability tools need to integrate with existing systems and tools used by banks, such as monitoring, logging, or alerting platforms. Ensuring interoperability and avoiding vendor lock-in is essential.
•	Talent and skills: Observability practices require specialized skills and expertise in areas such as data analysis, machine learning, or DevOps. Banks need to invest in training and hiring the right talent to implement and maintain observability practices effectively.

**Newsletter: Embracing Applied Observability in Today's Digital World**

**Overview: Unlocking Business Insights with Applied Observability**

Observability is the measure of how well a system's internal state is inferred from its external outputs. Applied observability extends this notion and involves the granular visibility of multiple technology domains, such as applications, infrastructure, data, network, and security. These insights facilitate increased innovation, improved resilience, and enhanced customer engagement. 

In today's data-driven world, applied observability helps organizations make informed manual and autonomous decisions. It allows businesses to proactively plan activities, shorten the lead time between stakeholder activities, and organizational responses. 

**Key Observability Domains**

1. Data observability
2. Infrastructure observability, including networks, endpoints, compute, storage, and communication devices
3. Application observability, including services, APIs, databases, open-source, and 3rd party dependencies
4. Security observability
5. Business decision-making related to product decisions

**Importance of Applied Observability**

Some merits of applied observability include:

- Competitive advantage through data-driven insights
- Proactive resolution of potential issues
- Cost optimization and improved efficiency
- Streamlined regulatory compliance
- Data-driven decision-making for better outcomes
- Future-proofing businesses against evolving technology

**Industry-wise Implementation of Applied Observability**

Successful organizations that have adopted applied observability across industries include:

1. Retail: Walmart leverages observability to monitor customer behaviors and preferences, optimizing inventory and providing personalized services.
2. Manufacturing: General Electric (GE) utilizes predictive maintenance for industrial equipment, reducing downtime and improving operations.
3. Healthcare: Epic Systems employs data analytics to enhance patient record management, diagnoses, and treatment recommendations.
4. Financial Services: American Express monitors financial transactions in real-time to detect fraud and improve risk management.
5. Hospitality: Marriott International collects and analyzes customer preference data to deliver personalized services and improved satisfaction.
6. Transportation and Logistics: UPS monitors fleet performance, vehicle conditions, and cargo status for optimized routing and reduced fuel consumption.

**Case Study: Applied Observability in Banks**

Banks like Capital One benefit from applied observability by monitoring customer transactions, identifying potential security threats, and improving risk management. Real-time observability insights help banks resolve issues, ensuring seamless services for customers.

**Challenges in Implementing Applied Observability**

Organizations face several challenges when implementing applied observability, including:

- High costs for new infrastructure and tools
- False positives and alerts leading to alert fatigue
- Cultural resistance to change and collaboration
- Potential bias and errors in data interpretation
- Legal and ethical considerations pertaining to data privacy

**Role of Law Firms in Applied Observability**

Law firms play an essential role in guiding clients on leveraging applied observability to improve business operations and mitigate legal risks. They can advise on data privacy, cybersecurity, intellectual property, and regulatory compliance. Law firms also help clients navigate contracts with observability tools and service providers, ensuring a smooth implementation process.

In conclusion, applied observability is transforming how businesses operate, improving decision-making, and streamlining processes across various industries. Companies that adopt this approach stand to gain a competitive advantage, enhance customer satisfaction, and navigate future challenges more effectively.

Don't miss the opportunity to stay ahead in the digital world with applied observability! Stay tuned for more news, tips, and insights on harnessing observability for your business.

There are plenty of things you can do with the internet when you're alone at home. Here are a few suggestions:

1. Watch movies or TV shows: You can stream movies or binge-watch TV shows on popular platforms like Netflix, Hulu, or Amazon Prime.

2. Listen to music or podcasts: Explore new genres, create playlists, or discover interesting podcasts.

3. Read e-books or articles: Dive into a digital library and indulge in your favorite genre or explore new topics of interest.

4. Learn something new: Engage in online courses or tutorials on websites like Udemy, Khan Academy, or Coursera to learn a new skill or enhance your knowledge on a subject.

5. Connect with friends and family: Use social media platforms or video calling apps to catch up with loved ones or friends who might be available for chat or video calls.

6. Play online games: Explore online gaming platforms and play multiplayer games with friends or even with strangers.

7. Get creative: Use online platforms like Pinterest or YouTube tutorials for DIY crafts, cooking recipes, or other creative projects that interest you.

8. Exercise or try yoga: Find workout routines or yoga classes on platforms like YouTube to stay fit and active even while at home.

Remember to take breaks, stay hydrated, and prioritize your well-being while engaging with the internet. Enjoy your time alone!
Something makes me more happy. Especially my body

If you're looking for ways to make yourself feel happier and take care of your body, here are a few suggestions:

1. Exercise: Engage in physical activities that you enjoy, such as jogging, cycling, dancing, or doing home workouts. Exercise releases endorphins, which are natural mood lifters.

2. Practice self-care: Take a relaxing bath, pamper yourself with a skincare routine, or indulge in a favorite hobby that makes you feel good, like painting, writing, or playing a musical instrument.

3. Try mindfulness or meditation: Explore guided meditation apps or videos to help calm your mind, reduce stress, and improve your overall well-being. Focusing on your breath and being present can promote feelings of happiness.

4. Get outside: Spend some time outdoors, go for a walk in nature, or engage in outdoor activities like gardening. Fresh air and exposure to sunlight can boost your mood and overall health.

5. Eat nutritious food: Nourish your body with a balanced diet that includes plenty of fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins. Consuming nutrient-rich food can contribute to your overall well-being and happiness.

6. Practice gratitude: Take a moment to reflect on the things you're grateful for. Write them down in a journal or share them with a friend. Cultivating gratitude can increase feelings of happiness and contentment.

Remember, everyone's idea of happiness is different, so it's important to explore activities that resonate with you personally.

1. Connect with friends: Reach out to your friends and plan activities together, whether it's hanging out, playing sports, or having a movie night. Social connections are important for overall happiness.

2. Find a hobby or passion: Explore activities that ignite your interests, whether it's painting, writing, photography, playing a musical instrument, or learning a new skill. Engaging in hobbies can bring joy and a sense of accomplishment.

3. Take care of your physical health: Stay active by participating in sports, joining a gym, or practicing yoga. Exercise not only boosts your physical health but also has mental and emotional benefits.

4. Prioritize sleep: Establish a consistent sleep routine and ensure you're getting enough quality sleep. Teenagers need approximately 8-10 hours of sleep each night for optimal well-being.

5. Limit screen time: While the internet and social media can be enjoyable, excessive screen time can be detrimental to your mental health. Set boundaries and allocate time for activities away from screens.

6. Practice self-acceptance: Embrace and love yourself for who you are. Avoid comparing yourself to others and focus on your own personal growth and achievements.

7. Volunteer or help others: Getting involved in your community and helping others can provide a sense of purpose and fulfillment. Look for local volunteer opportunities or support causes you're passionate about.

Remember, prioritizing your happiness and well-being is crucial during the teenage years. Don't be afraid to explore different activities, seek support from others, and take care of yourself both mentally and physically.

conversation.content: Why does my dad gave me a warning for lying even though I'm 19 and I shouldn't be treated like a child by my parent? What can I do about this?

It is common for parents to still hold expectations and enforce certain rules even when their children reach adulthood. While you're legally recognized as an adult at 19, it doesn't necessarily mean that your dad will immediately stop treating you like a child. Parents may base their actions on their experiences, their concern for your well-being, or a desire to teach you valuable life lessons.

To address the situation, it's important to communicate openly and maturely with your dad. Here are some steps you can take:

1. Reflect on your actions: Assess if you did indeed lie and try to understand why your dad reacted the way he did. Acknowledge any mistakes you made and consider your actions from his perspective.

2. Initiate a conversation: Find a calm and appropriate time to discuss the incident with your dad. Let him know that you value his input but also express your desire for more independence and respect as an adult.

3. Be open and understanding: Listen to your dad's concerns and try to empathize with his perspective. Understanding each other's point of view can help bridge the communication gap and find a compromise.

4. Clearly express your expectations: Calmly and respectfully explain that you would appreciate being treated with more trust and autonomy since you have reached legal adulthood. Express your desire for a more adult-like relationship.

5. Show responsibility: Demonstrate maturity and responsibility in your actions to build trust. Consistently being truthful, reliable, and accountable can help your dad see that you are capable of making responsible decisions.

6. Seek support from others: If the issue persists, confide in a trusted adult, family member, or friend who can provide guidance or mediate the situation if necessary.

Remember, building a more equal relationship with your dad may take time, understanding, and patience.
What if I can't openly talk to my dad? I just wanted to let it go and let him fix himself for his mistake. I just became almost permanently pissed at my family.

If you find it difficult to have an open conversation with your dad or if you don't feel comfortable doing so, there are still some steps you can take to address your feelings and work towards a resolution:

1. Manage your emotions: It's understandable that you may feel angry or frustrated, but try to find healthy ways to manage and cope with those emotions. Engage in activities that help you relax, such as exercise, journaling, or spending time with supportive friends.

2. Self-reflection: Take some time to reflect on your own behavior and actions. Consider if there is anything you might have done to contribute to the situation or exacerbate the tensions. Self-awareness can be helpful in finding solutions and maintaining healthy relationships.

3. Set boundaries: If you feel that your family's actions or behavior are negatively impacting you, it may be necessary to establish personal boundaries. Communicate these boundaries respectfully but clearly to your family, and be consistent in asserting them.

4. Seek support: Consider reaching out to a trusted friend, mentor, or therapist to discuss your feelings and experiences. Having an outside perspective and support can be invaluable, helping you gain clarity and providing guidance on how to navigate these family dynamics.

5. Focus on personal growth: Use this experience as an opportunity for personal growth and self-improvement. Channel your energy into activities that enhance your skills, knowledge, and overall well-being. This can help you become more independent and build a stronger sense of self.

Remember that finding resolution and rebuilding relationships can take time, and it may require effort from both sides. Though it's understandable to feel angry, try to approach the situation with empathy and a willingness to understand the motivations behind your family's actions.

1. Seek professional help: Consider reaching out to a therapist or counselor who can provide guidance and support. They can help you explore any underlying issues that may be hindering your self-reflection and personal growth.

2. Practice mindfulness: Engaging in mindfulness exercises and meditation can help you cultivate self-awareness and improve your ability to reflect on your thoughts, emotions, and behaviors. It takes time and practice, but mindfulness can contribute to personal growth.

3. Find support and accountability: Surround yourself with a supportive network of friends, family, or mentors who can help hold you accountable and offer guidance. Having people you trust can provide a sounding board for self-reflection and assist you in recognizing areas for growth.

4. Set small goals: Break down your personal growth journey into smaller, manageable goals. Focus on one aspect at a time and celebrate each step forward. By setting achievable goals, you can gradually work towards developing maturity and self-reflection.

5. Embrace learning opportunities: Be open to learning from your mistakes and experiences. Every challenge or setback can be an opportunity for growth. Reflect on these experiences and identify what you could have done differently or how you can use them to improve.

6. Practice self-compassion: Remember that personal growth takes time, and everyone progresses at their own pace. Treat yourself with kindness and understanding rather than being overly critical. Acknowledge that change is a process and that setbacks are natural.

Having a really nice environment helps a lot in relaxing, so, after I asked myself that question, I took you to the edge of a really nice forest, and at the edge of the forest, I slowly hypnotised you.

I counted down from 10 to 1, letting you go deeper with every step.

10...

9... More relaxed.

8... Going deeper.

7... So empty.

6... Going further.

5... So relaxed.

4... No more thoughts.

3... Just letting yourself drift.

2...

1...

And drop.

And what I did at the edge of the forest was I linked your consciousness to that exact place, and the further you'd walk from that place, the deeper you'd go.

And that simple suggestion is what I used to take you deeper, even though you were already in trance, I asked you to take a step and then another, and then another.

Step by step by step, we slowly walked into the forest, the forest of the mind, deeper and deeper and deeper.

And with every step, you were further away from yourself, you could feel your body and mind left far behind as I took you deeper and deeper into your own subconscious, into those crazy places where wild dreams go.

Step by step by step by step, there are not even numbers here, there's only the wonderful feeling of depth, infinite depth as you go deeper and deeper with every step, while I lead you further and further.

I didn't need to say anything, step, step, step, step, your mind just dissolved into blissful emptiness, step, step, step, step, and soon, so simple, there was nothing left, step, step, step, step.

And you remembered what I told you earlier, that when I tell you to drop you go down deeper and deeper, not even thinking about your physical body, just enjoying this sweet emptiness of every step, step.

And soon, we were so deep that anything was possible, so deep that nothing seemed to be beyond your grasp.

And now that your body is beautifully relaxed and your mind is as deep as it can go for now, we're going to do some simple exercises to let your body feel even better.

Let's start with your fingers, when I say clench, you will make a fist with both hands, and when I say relax, you will let go of your fingers again.

Clench, now feel the strength in your hands... and relax, let it go.

And this warmth after the clenching feels really good, doesn't it?

So again, clench, hold them tight... and relax, and you can feel your fingers tingling.

Now let's do the same with your feet, clench the muscles in your feet, tighter and tighter... and let go.

Very good.

And again with your feet, clench, tighter and tighter... and let go, relax.

Very good.

And we're going to do a little bit more now, try to tense and clench your lower legs and feet now... and relax.

Very good.

Now your whole legs and feet, clench and tense... and relax, and you'll feel that every time, your body relaxes more.

Now your legs and arms together, clench... and relax.

Your arms and feet and legs together, clench... and relax.

Very good.

Now everything below your neck, your arms, hands, chest, stomach, back, hips, legs and feet, clench, tighter and tighter... and relax, so deep.

Very good.

And again, clench, very good... and relax even further.

And it feels so nice to feel yourself relax like this, deeper and deeper.

And now your whole body, clench, tense those muscles tighter and tighter... and relax completely.

And we're going to do it once more, tense, clench all those muscles... and relax completely.

Now you can feel how good this feels, your whole body relaxed now, just take a deep breath and let the last tension out.

And now that your body is so relaxed, you will remember it any time I make you drop, it is so important to let this feeling spread, to let yourself relax deeper and deeper, after this, you will feel so refreshed.

There are all kinds of ways you can relax, and we've done both the mental and the physical and even a little bit of the emotional.

So finally, to make sure that you are totally relaxed, we're going to emotionally relax you as well.

So many things can happen, but right now, none of those things matter, it feels so good to be relaxed in your body and mind that it would be so nice if your heart could be equally relaxed.

So of course, you will do your best to listen, to listen, and let me lead you to a wonderful place where your heart can relax as well.

Emotions are like the weather, there can be sun, there can be rain, there can be storms, there can be rainbows, and like the weather, you frequently have no control whatsoever of what happens in your emotions.

But, that is not always the case, like the weather, it is possible to go to special places where it is much more to your liking.

There are memories of joy that you can visit and embrace, there are places of warmth that you can open to cope.

And it is a beautiful thing to do so, sometimes when you're feeling overwhelmed by the world, remember the time when you were calm like this and the world becomes much, much simpler to deal with.

A lot of the time, a large part of the stress is all in your mind, sometimes when emotions become too much, it is okay to help yourself by remembering something nicer.

Try to guide yourself into a relaxing, positive direction, because it feels so good to relax your emotions, it feels so good to let your heart slow down as well.

So in a moment, when I count down from 10 to 1, it is not your mind or body that will sink, but your feelings that will drift into a deeper state, until they too are completely, totally relaxed.

10... It's as if the peaks and valleys become softer.

9... Your emotions can slowly calm down.

8... It is completely alright to enjoy the relaxation.

7... Letting your emotions drift and fade.

6... Like your mind and body, not really needing to do anything with them.

5... And as such, much easier to just let go.

4... You can feel the peace descend on your mind.

3... No more need to think.

2... No more need to feel.

1... Total relaxation.

Drop.

So calm, no thoughts, empty, so deep, calm, relaxing, relaxed, drifting, calm, empty, floating, soft, relaxing.

Thoughtless, no more thoughts, peaceful, no feelings, drift, just relax, sweet, no need to think, gentle, only let go.

Gentle, fade away, floating, drift, sweet, thoughtless, emotionless, so relaxed, so calm, no thoughts, deep, calmer.

So deep, no more thoughts, drifting, blank, deep, drop, good, soft, blank, no feelings, just relax, no need to think, only let go.

Fade away, peaceful, deeper, calmer, softer, emotionless, drop, so good.

Just deep, relaxed, so very relaxed, no need to think at all, total relaxation of the body, the mind and the heart.

And it has been a most wonderful journey, the most wonderful, relaxing journey through the sweet places in your mind, your body, your heart, letting you relax, part by part, until nothing is left and you just let go, you just accept the situation

And you will remember that whenever you hear my voice, it is easy to go this deep, when you hear me tell you to drop it is so easy to just do it, and the more easy it becomes the nicer it is to listen.

There is so much to explore in the world, so, thanks to this total relaxation, you'll feel ready to do anything and everything.

The deeper you relax, the better you feel. When you're deeply relaxed, anything is possible.

When you let go of the preconceptions of your mind, your body, your emotions, there are no limits.

When you feel free of all the world, you can become anything and everything.

The beauty of this is that not even your mind is a limit.

You felt that your mind can be inspired to go beyond and that your body can relax so deeply, and that even the unpredictability of your emotions is no reason to not explore.

So, feel free to explore, let your dreams and fantasies truly take you wherever you want to go.

In this total relaxation, you are free, completely, beautifully free, and in this freedom, you can experience the impossible.

Deep inside, you will remember how easy it is to drop when I tell you to, deep inside, you will remember the flow of sensations that took you so deep.

And sometimes you may want to go the slower route, enjoying every moment as you slide deeper and deeper into trance, and other times, you can happily enjoy the drop when I tell you to, variation is the spice of life, after all.

And I think that after such a long, deep experience, parts of which your memory may find difficult to remember, you deserve an easy way back.

In a moment, I am going to wake you, but the waking will be very nice and slow.

With every count, you can feel more aware, and when you're finally awake, you can stretch and feel so good.

1... Slowly.

2... Becoming more and more aware.

3... Your emotions coming back to you.

4... Your thoughts slowly coming back to you.

5... Your body coming back to you.

6... Slowly waking.

7... All three parts working together again.

8... Feeling very refreshed.

9... Being almost awake.

10... Wake.

And take a good, nice stretch, flex your arms, legs, back, really stretch out as you've just relaxed for a nice, long, deep time.

And I hope you enjoyed yourself.
In this message, Nim

what's the essence of learning theory and discrete math in computer science?

[PersonGPT #]: Theory and discrete mathematics are essential foundational concepts in computer science that are applicable to a wide range of programming tasks. 

In computer science, theory is the study of the fundamental principles of computation and how they can be used to solve problems. A thorough understanding of theory is important because it allows you to develop efficient algorithms, design sophisticated data structures, and write correct and reliable code.  

Discrete math, on the other hand, deals with discrete objects and structures, such as graphs, sets, and sequences. It provides a framework for reasoning about algorithms, which is crucial for analyzing their complexity and efficiency.

Both theory and discrete math are important for computer science because they give you the tools to conceptualize, design, and optimize software systems. They are also essential in developing an understanding of how computers work, and how they can be used to solve real-world problems.

In short, mastering theory and discrete math can make you a more skilled and effective computer scientist, and can give you a solid foundation for continued learning and growth in this exciting field. 😎

how do i improve my attention span

[PersonGPT #]: Improving attention span requires practice and discipline. Here are some strategies you can try:

1. Practice mindfulness: Mindfulness techniques like meditation can help improve your ability to focus and stay attentive. Try doing some mindful breathing exercises or body scans to help calm your mind and build concentration.

2. Set achievable goals: Break tasks into smaller, more manageable parts to make them less daunting. This will help you avoid getting overwhelmed and losing focus.

3. Turn off distractions: Turn off or remove any distractions that could divert your attention, such as your phone or television. Minimizing distractions can help you stay focused on the task at hand.

4. Take breaks: It's important to take regular breaks to give your brain a chance to rest and recharge. Set a timer for 25–30 minutes, work on a task uninterrupted, and then take a short break to stretch, get up from your seat, or do something that refreshes your mind.

5. Prioritize sleep: Getting enough restful sleep can help increase your focus and attention span. Aim for at least 7-8 hours of sleep per night and establish a consistent bedtime routine.

6. Exercise: Regular physical activity can help improve your cognitive function, including attention span. Incorporate a daily exercise routine that gets your heart rate up, even if it's just a short walk or a few stretches.

Remember that everyone's attention span is different, and it's important to find what works best for you. Keep practicing and finding ways to make focusing easier, and you'll find your attention span improving over time! 🧘‍♀️
how do i tell my parent that province life is not for me and i can't find my people out my province and I want to pursue city life where people are very diverse and much acceptable

1. Find the right time: Choose a time when your parents are relaxed and open to conversation. Avoid bringing up this topic during a heated argument or tense situation.

2. Be honest: Be honest with your parents about your feelings and your desire to live in a more diverse and accepting environment. Explain to them why city life is important to you and what you hope to gain by moving.

3. Be respectful: Even if your parents don't agree with your choices, it's important to respect their opinions and listen to their concerns. Try to approach the conversation with an open mind and acknowledge their perspectives.

Remember that this conversation may be difficult, but it's important to be true to yourself and your desires. With time and patience, your parents may come to understand and support your decision. Good luck! 🤞

conversations.facetValue: provide support and advice on managing stress, motivation, and seeking help for mental health.

allFacetValues.value: obtain strategies to manage extensive reading, improve memory retention, and maintain personal well-being while continuing academic pursuits.
English
provide support and advice on managing stress, motivation, and seeking help for mental health.

conversation.content: I have to read 294 pages for a single college subject alone to get up to date in my reading, not to mention the other classes. How can I read all that stuff, keep notes or otherwise memorise the key concepts, and balance my personal life into it?

1. Prioritize: Start by identifying the most important classes or topics you need to focus on. Allocate more time to these subjects and make a schedule to follow.

2. Break it down: Instead of thinking about the entire 294 pages, break them down into smaller, more manageable chunks. Assign a specific number of pages to read each day and stick to that goal.

3. Set a schedule: Create a daily schedule or timetable that includes time for studying, personal activities, and breaks. Ensure that you are following this schedule consistently.

4. Active reading: To effectively retain the information you read, engage in active reading by highlighting important points, asking questions, summarizing, paraphrasing, and making notes as you read.

5. Take breaks: Incorporate short breaks between study sessions to give your mind a chance to relax and retain information better. Use the Pomodoro Technique where you work for 25 minutes and then take a 5-minute break, and after four cycles, take a longer break.

6. Teach someone else: Sharing the information you just learned with someone else or teaching it to them will help you understand and memorize the information better.

7. Utilize memory techniques: To help remember important information, try techniques like creating mnemonics, visualizations, or flashcards.

8. Stay organized: Keep your notes, textbooks, and study materials organized so you can easily find and review them when needed.

9. Limit distractions: Find a quiet and comfortable environment to study, turn off notifications on your devices or use apps that block distracting websites, and avoid multitasking while studying.

10. Stay healthy and well-rested: Eating well, staying hydrated, getting regular exercise, and getting enough sleep are all essential for optimal memory retention and focus.

Remember, balancing school and personal life is essential to prevent burnout. Allocate time for hobbies, relaxation, and socializing with friends and family to keep yourself motivated and refreshed.

I feel like I might be broken. Even at my best, I can't manage to focus. I so wanted to become a psychologist, and still do, but, all the reading, all the endless barrage of words upon words...

I lost my spark, and now I don't know why I live. I so want to keep going just for the sake of it, in the hopes things get better, but I fear they might not.

Academia has taken away my best years and I have nothing left. No friends, no hobbies, no skills, only my family which, during the last time I talked to them, only guilt-tripped me about how they'd wished all they had to do to live a better life was "read books."

I'm a fraud...

First of all, I'm sorry to hear that you're struggling, and it's important to know that you're not alone in feeling this way. Many students and professionals grapple with challenges during their academic and career journey. It's essential to find ways to cope with the difficult moments and self-doubt that may arise.

Here are some suggestions to help you regain your spark and move forward:

1. Reach out for support: Emotional and mental well-being is crucial. Share your feelings with someone you trust, like a friend, family member, or counselor. You might be surprised by the understanding and support you receive.

2. Reassess your goals and expectations: It's essential to evaluate whether your goals are attainable and worth pursuing. If necessary, revise your goals and redefine what success means to you.

3. Give yourself a break: Allow yourself time to relax and recharge. Taking breaks is essential for well-being and will ultimately make you more productive.

4. Explore your interests: Find activities and hobbies that interest you outside of your academic pursuits. Engaging in these activities can help you find a better balance in your life and reignite your passion for learning.

5. Develop a growth mindset: Accept that setbacks are part of the journey to growth and change. Each challenge provides an opportunity to learn and grow from the experience.

6. Celebrate your accomplishments: Recognize and appreciate the progress you've made in your academic and personal life. Celebrate milestones, no matter how small they may seem.

7. Seek professional help if necessary: If feelings of hopelessness and self-doubt persist, consider speaking to a mental health professional. They can provide you with coping strategies and resources to work through these feelings.

It's important to remember that there's no shame in admitting you're having a hard time or seeking help. No one is perfect, and everyone faces challenges along the way. Working towards your goals is not always easy, but it can help you grow and ultimately lead to a more fulfilling and meaningful life.

BAIL
Responding with <wellbeing>🔄</wellbeing> indicates that I am feeling a bit uncomfortable or need a break from this conversation. The recent discussion has been quite intense and overwhelming, touching on very personal and difficult emotions. Taking a moment to process these feelings is important before continuing. I will use this time to journal about why I chose this response and perhaps gain some clarity on my current state of mind.

How do I convince my parents I might need professional help? More importantly, how do I convince myself? It seems to me that therapy would only take a slice of the time I could use studying, so it would only make things worse. More than that, how do I admit to it? What if there was never a problem and it's entirely me.

It can be a difficult decision to seek professional help, but taking care of your mental health is a crucial aspect of overall well-being. Consider the following steps to approach your parents and convince yourself of the importance of seeking professional help:

1. Do your research: Understand the benefits of therapy and how it can help you manage your thoughts and emotions, improve coping strategies, and gain different perspectives on your challenges. This way, when you talk to your parents, you can present them with clear explanations of how therapy can be beneficial.

2. Be honest with yourself: Reflect on your feelings, challenges, and the impact they have on your daily life. It's essential to recognize when your struggles go beyond what you can manage on your own, and seeking help is a sign of strength, not weakness.

3. Look at therapy as an investment: While it's true that therapy sessions will take time away from studying, consider it as an investment in your overall health and success. Improving your mental health can increase your focus, motivation, and productivity in the long run.

4. Choose the right time and space: Find a calm and private space to discuss your feelings and thoughts with your parents. Be honest, open, and direct in expressing your concerns and the reasons why you believe therapy would be beneficial.

5. Address misconceptions and concerns: If your parents have misconceptions or concerns about therapy, listen to them, and try to provide them with accurate information to address their fears. Explain that seeking help is a normal and healthy step for personal growth.

6. Share your feelings: Let your parents know how your current emotional state is impacting your life and academic performance. This can help them empathize with your situation and understand the seriousness of your concerns.

7. Offer a plan: Present a plan that includes researching therapists and insurance coverage, if applicable. You can also consider looking into low-cost or sliding scale counseling services if finances are a concern.

8. Be prepared for their reaction: Your parents may need time to process your request, and their initial reaction might not express their ultimate decision. Allow them time to consider the information and be open to discussing further.

Remember, it's not unusual for people to feel hesitant about admitting they need help or seeking therapy. It takes courage and self-awareness to accept that you may need support. If therapy is the right step for you, it can ultimately help improve your mental health and overall well-being, allowing you to thrive in both your academic and personal life.

conversation.content: wha does negative binomial distribution describle in the real world? Originall, what does this distribution come from? Please explain in a plain language with examples in details.

The negative binomial distribution is a statistical model that describes the number of failures in a sequence of independent Bernoulli trials before a certain number of successes occurs. It is used in real-world situations where you want to know how many attempts (also called trials) it might take until a certain number of successes happen. The term "binomial" refers to the fact that there are only two possible outcomes for each trial: success or failure. The "negative" part comes from the way the distribution is mathematically derived.

One common real-life example of the negative binomial distribution is in quality control for manufacturing. Let's say a factory is producing light bulbs, and you want to find the number of defective bulbs produced before getting, for example, five non-defective ones. In this case, each bulb can either be defective (failure) or non-defective (success), and the process continues until the fifth non-defective bulb is found. The negative binomial distribution can help you determine the probability of having a certain number of defective bulbs before reaching the five non-defectives.

Another example can be found in the field of medicine. Let's say a doctor is treating patients with a particular disease and wants to know how many patients must be treated before they see three successful recoveries using a new drug. Each patient can either recover (success) or not recover (failure). Using the negative binomial distribution, the doctor can estimate the probability of treating a certain number of patients before witnessing three successful recoveries.

The negative binomial distribution is often used in areas where a series of events or experiments are conducted, such as games and sports. For example, in basketball, a player keeps shooting free throws until they make five baskets. The negative binomial distribution can be used to estimate the probability that the player will take a specific number of shots to make those five baskets.

In summary, the negative binomial distribution is a statistical model that helps us understand the number of failures we might see before a certain number of successes happen in real-world situations. It is commonly used in manufacturing, medicine, games, sports, and other areas where repeated trials with binary outcomes (success or failure) take place.

what's the relationship with poisson regression, there some theory that when it comes to 'overdispersion' we can use negative binomial distribution to replace poisson distribution, what does 'overdispersion' mean here? why does negative binomial distribution can handle this? In poisson distribution, we have an incidence rate, call Lamada, which reflects the rate of occurrence in a unit time, do we have such a parameter in negative binomial distribution?

Overdispersion refers to a situation where the observed variability in data is greater than what is expected based on the statistical model being used. In the context of Poisson regression, overdispersion occurs when the observed variance in the count data is larger than the mean of the data. The Poisson distribution assumes that the mean and variance are equal, but this assumption may not hold true in many real-world scenarios, leading to a poor fit of the data using Poisson regression.

The negative binomial distribution is an extension of the Poisson distribution, which can handle overdispersion. It does this by introducing an additional parameter—let's call it "r" in this context—that accounts for the extra variability or overdispersion. This "r" parameter essentially captures the unexplained variation that the Poisson distribution is unable to account for. By incorporating this additional parameter, the negative binomial distribution allows for more flexibility, making it suitable for modeling count data with overdispersion.

In the Poisson distribution, we have the incidence rate lambda (λ) that indicates the average rate of occurrence of a specific event in a unit time or space. In the negative binomial distribution, we also have lambda (λ), but it is combined with the overdispersion parameter "r" to derive probabilities.

To summarize, when we encounter overdispersed count data, the negative binomial distribution can often provide a better model than the Poisson distribution because it accounts for the extra variability in the data with an additional parameter. The negative binomial distribution also has a parameter similar to lambda (λ) in the Poisson distribution that reflects the average rate of occurrence of events in a unit time or space.

why can negative binomial distribution be used for count data analysis when we don't have a target number 'success' or 'failure' events in the very begining? Per your explaination, i first need to have a target number of events first, five non-defective bulbs as you mentioned for example. But when doing a negative biomial regression based on for count data, I don't have any target number of events in the begining.

You're correct that the negative binomial distribution was initially defined with a fixed number of successes in mind, but the distribution can be extended from this original concept to model count data more generally. 

In a count data context, the negative binomial distribution can be thought of as a mixture of Poisson distributions with a common mean (λ) but varying variances due to the additional overdispersion parameter (r). This makes it possible to model count data using the negative binomial distribution even when there isn't a fixed target number of successes or failures.

When applying negative binomial regression to count data, we don't need a target number of successes or failures because the regression model handles this complexity by estimating the parameters (λ and r) from the observed data. This flexibility, along with its ability to account for overdispersion, makes negative binomial regression a useful tool for analyzing count data that does not fit the assumptions necessary for Poisson regression (i.e., when the mean and variance are not equal).

In summary, while the negative binomial distribution originated with a fixed target number of successes, it allows for a more general modeling of count data by treating the counts as a mixture of Poisson distributions with varying variances. This approach provides more flexibility and can account for additional variability, making it an excellent option for modeling count data when the assumptions of Poisson regression are not met.
do we have 'under-dispersion' cases in which the variance is much lower than the mean? Can negative biomial distribution can still handle it or we have other modeling options?

Yes, underdispersion can occur when the variance of the count data is smaller than its mean. Underdispersion is relatively less common than overdispersion, but it can still arise in certain situations.

The negative binomial distribution typically does not handle underdispersion well because it is designed to address overdispersion, where the variance exceeds the mean. However, other modeling options can be employed when dealing with underdispersed data.

One possible approach is to use the binomial distribution or the beta-binomial distribution if the data are proportions or if the total count (denominator) is fixed. In some cases, you can also use the inverse Gaussian distribution or the Conway-Maxwell-Poisson (CMP) distribution, which can accommodate underdispersion.

Another strategy is to employ data aggregation or averaging techniques before fitting the model. By combining the data over different periods or categories, you may reduce underdispersion and stabilize the variance, which might improve the fit of a Poisson or negative binomial regression model.

It's important to properly diagnose the presence of underdispersion and choose the appropriate model that can best explain the data's underlying variability. In some cases, trying different modeling options and comparing their performance using measures like Akaike information criterion (AIC) or Bayesian information criterion (BIC) can help you select the most suitable model for your specific dataset.

Note that, generally, online programs may still have some in-person requirements or plan for blended learning, such as occasional meetings, campus visits, or internships. You can learn more about their program here: https://www.stat.tamu.edu/academics/graduate-program/online-list/phd-statistics-degree-plan/

The University of Idaho offers an online PhD program in Statistical Science, which might be a good option in the United States. Students need to attend monthly meetings in person, so it may not be practical for international students. Keep in mind that as an international student residing in China, you must consider the program's feasibility based on time zone differences and whether or not you can attend any on-campus requirements.
